description: Tidal waters and NOAA tide stations for coastal crappie fishing areas

tidal_waters.name: Sabine Lake
tidal_waters.notes: Large brackish estuary on TX/LA border. White crappie present in fresher upper reaches. Tides significantly affect water movement and fish positioning. Best crappie fishing in tributary creeks during outgoing tide.

tidal_waters.name: Lake Pontchartrain
tidal_waters.notes: Large brackish estuary connected to Gulf. Crappie found in fresher bayous and the Tchefuncte River area. Wind-driven tides more significant than lunar. Target tributary mouths when tide is moving.

tidal_waters.name: Mobile-Tensaw Delta
tidal_waters.notes: America's largest inland delta. Excellent crappie fishing in the maze of creeks and lakes. Tide influences water levels 20+ miles upriver. Rising tide pushes fish into flooded timber.

tidal_waters.name: Lake Borgne Area
tidal_waters.notes: Brackish estuary with crappie in fresher tributaries. Strong tidal influence from Gulf. Fish freshwater inflows during falling tide.

tidal_waters.name: Calcasieu Lake
tidal_waters.notes: Southwest Louisiana estuary. Crappie in Prien Lake and upper Calcasieu River. Tides affect water clarity and fish movement.

tidal_waters.name: Apalachicola Bay System
tidal_waters.notes: Florida Panhandle estuary with crappie in river and tributary creeks. Spring crappie runs follow tide patterns.

tidal_waters.name: St. Johns River (Tidal Section)
tidal_waters.notes: North-flowing Florida river with tidal influence to Palatka. Black crappie abundant. Tide affects fishing 100+ miles from ocean. Target oxbow lakes during stable tide.

tidal_waters.name: Waccamaw River / Lake Waccamaw
tidal_waters.notes: Coastal Carolina blackwater river. Lake Waccamaw is freshwater but tidal influence affects lower river. Trophy crappie fishing.

tidal_waters.name: Santee Cooper Lakes (Tidal Section)
tidal_waters.notes: Lower Santee River has tidal influence. Famous crappie lakes (Marion/Moultrie) are freshwater but river section is tidal.

tidal_waters.name: Neuse River Estuary
tidal_waters.notes: North Carolina coastal river. Crappie in fresher upstream sections. Wind-driven tides affect lower river fishing.
